chapter.title: Installing OpenStack Clients
chapter.para: If you have a standalone deployer, the OpenStack CLI and other clients will not be installed automatically on that node. If you require access to these clients, you will need to follow the procedure below to add the appropriate software.

step.para: [OPTIONAL] Connect to your standalone deployer and try to use the OpenStack CLI:
step.screen:
source ~/keystone.osrc openstack project list
-bash: openstack: command not found

step.para: Edit the configuration file containing details of your Control Plane, typically ~/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml.
Locate the stanza for the cluster where you want to install the client(s). For a standalone deployer, this will look like the following extract:
step.screen: clusters: - name: cluster0 cluster-prefix: c0 server-role: LIFECYCLE-MANAGER-ROLE member-count: 1 allocation-policy: strict service-components: - ntp-server - lifecycle-manager

step.para: Choose the client(s) you wish to install from the following list of available clients:
step.screen: - openstack-client - cinder-client - designate-client - glance-client - heat-client - ironic-client - keystone-client - neutron-client - nova-client - swift-client - monasca-client - barbican-client

step.para: Add the client(s) to the list of service-components - in this example, we add the openstack-client to the standalone deployer:
step.screen: clusters: - name: cluster0 cluster-prefix: c0 server-role: LIFECYCLE-MANAGER-ROLE member-count: 1 allocation-policy: strict service-components: - ntp-server - lifecycle-manager - openstack-client - cinder-client - designate-client - glance-client - heat-client - ironic-client - keystone-client - neutron-client - nova-client - swift-client - monasca-client - barbican-client
cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible git add -A git commit -m "Add explicit client service deployment"

step.para: Run the configuration processor, followed by the ready-deployment playbook:
step.screen: cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml -e encrypt="" \ -e rekey="" ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
